results.title: St. James Cathedral
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Ampol Petroleum Ltd, Kingcroft Productions and National Trust
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “National Trust”.
A look at St James Cathedral in Melbourne, which was designed in 1839 by Robert Russell.

results.title: St Paul's Cathedral
results.creator_credit: James E. Rogers and Merton Park
results.brief_description: A survey of London’s most famous cathedral, in itself a monument to Sir Christopher Wren. Its nave, central dome, whispering gallery, choir and high altar enshringe memorials to Nelson, Wellington, Gordon, Kitchener, and other famous men of the British Isles. Narrated by Robert Speaight,

results.title: St Kilda: the lonely islands
results.creator_credit: Christopher Mylne and Films of Scotland
results.brief_description: An evocation of the sense of timelessness which impresses itself on a visitor to this island in the Outer Hebrides. Depicts the unique fauna, and breathtaking beauty of the place, and shows the work of conservationists on the island.
results.description: An evocation of the sense of timelessness which impresses itself on a visitor to this island in the Outer Hebrides. Depicts the unique fauna, and breathtaking beauty of the place, and shows the work of conservationists on the island.

results.title: Squeak the squirrel
results.creator_credit: Lester F. Beck and Churchill-Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: A baby squirrel is used in experiments to show how animals learn. He soon learns not to be afraid of people, finds how to get nuts out of glass tubes and out of boxes. He stuffs them in his cheek pouches and scurries off to hoard them in his nest.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lester F. Beck and Churchill-Wexler Film Productions

results.title: Square pegs, round holes (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Helps young people understand individualism and the pressures of conformity by presenting an animated story about a cube who learns from its disappointments in trying to fit into round holes that being different is just as good as being the same.
results.description: Helps young people understand individualism and the pressures of conformity by presenting an animated story about a cube who learns from its disappointments in trying to fit into round holes that being different is just as good as being the same.

results.title: Springtime in the ranges
results.creator_credit: J.A. Correll and South Australian Government Tourist Bureau
results.brief_description: Depicts the activities which go on in the South Australian ranges during Spring. Shows the unique natural flora and fauna, and the agricultural pursuits of the area.

results.title: Springboard techniques: the forward and backward lifts
results.brief_description: A prerequisite for skilful diving is a thorough understanding of the functions of the springboard in diving. Stop-motion and slow motion are used in this film to give a detailed analysis of lifts, tucks, somersaults, and other types of diving movements, both in training for diving, and in actual dives by experts.
